title: Specialty teams spark Wolverines
text:
Report Error 
The Waywayseecappo Wolverines’ specialty teams dominated their Manitoba Junior Hockey League game on Sunday. 
The Wolverines got three power-play goals and added a short-handed marker as they beat the host Neepawa Natives 5-3. 
Elsewhere on Sunday, it was: Portage Terriers 2, Winnipeg Blues 1; and Selkirk Steelers 4, OCN Blizzard 3 in a shootout. 
In Saturday’s games, which were all played at Winnipeg’s MTS IcePlex as part of the league’s showcase weekend, it was: Virden Oil Capitals 4, Terriers 1; Winkler Flyers 6, Natives 0; Blizzard 7, Steelers 4; Dauphin Kings 6, Blues 5 in overtime; and Steinbach Pistons 4, Swan Valley Stampeders 3. 
At Neepawa, Johl Swedlo netted a pair of markers for the Wolverines (1-3-1), while Shoal Lake’s Riley Shamray and Rivers’ Brock Paddock added singles. Patrick Carlin scored two goals of his own for the Natives (2-4-0), who have lost their last four contests. 
Terriers 2 Blues 1
